crop_diseases.name: Blast (Leaf and Neck Blast)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Diamond-shaped lesions with grey center and brown margins on leaves. Neck blast causes rotting at panicle base, leading to white empty panicles (chaffy grains).
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Tricyclazole 75% WP at 0.6 g/L or Isoprothiolane 40% EC at 1.5 ml/L. Two sprays at boot leaf and flowering stage.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Pseudomonas fluorescens at 10 g/L. Apply neem oil 5% spray. Avoid excess nitrogen application.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant varieties (Rajendra, Tellahamsa). Balanced fertilization. Avoid close spacing. Seed treatment with Carbendazim.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana rice-growing districts especially Warangal, Nizamabad, Karimnagar

crop_diseases.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight (BLB)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions starting from leaf tips and margins, turning yellow to white. Leaves dry up from the tip. Milky bacterial ooze visible in early morning.
crop_diseases.treatment: No effective chemical cure. Spray Streptocycline 0.015% + Copper oxychloride 0.25%. Drain excess water from fields.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil 3%. Apply Pseudomonas fluorescens at 10 g/L. Avoid excess nitrogen.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use BLB-resistant varieties. Avoid excess nitrogen. Ensure proper drainage. Remove infected plant debris.
crop_diseases.region: Nizamabad, Warangal, Khammam, Suryapet - especially in heavily irrigated areas

crop_diseases.name: Brown Plant Hopper (BPH)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Circular patches of yellowing and drying called 'hopper burn'. Plants turn brown and dry up in patches. Honeydew secretion causes sooty mold on lower leaves.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Pymetrozine 50% WG at 0.3 g/L or Dinotefuran 20% SG at 0.4 g/L. Direct spray at base of plant.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Drain water from field for 3-4 days. Install light traps at 1/acre. Conserve natural enemies like spiders and mirid bugs.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid excessive nitrogen. Do not spray broad-spectrum insecticides early. Maintain 20cm spacing. Use resistant varieties.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana rice-growing districts, especially during Kharif season

crop_diseases.name: Sheath Blight
crop_diseases.symptoms: Oval to irregular greenish-grey lesions on leaf sheath near water level. Lesions enlarge and coalesce causing leaves to dry. White mycelial growth visible.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Hexaconazole 5% EC at 2 ml/L or Validamycin 3% SL at 2 ml/L at early symptom appearance.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Reduce nitrogen dose. Improve air circulation by wider spacing.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid dense planting. Balanced nitrogen use. Remove and destroy infected stubble. Avoid continuous rice cropping.
crop_diseases.region: Common across Telangana, more severe in irrigated lowland rice

crop_diseases.name: Stem Borer (Yellow Stem Borer)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Dead heart (central leaf dries up) in vegetative stage. White ear (empty white panicle) in reproductive stage. Frass visible at stem base.
crop_diseases.treatment: Apply Cartap hydrochloride 4G at 25 kg/ha in standing water. Or spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.3 ml/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Release Trichogramma japonicum egg parasitoids at 1 lakh/acre, 3 releases at weekly intervals. Install pheromone traps.
crop_diseases.prevention: Clip leaf tips while transplanting. Remove stubble after harvest. Avoid late planting. Use moderately resistant varieties.
crop_diseases.region: All rice-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Pink Bollworm
crop_diseases.symptoms: Rosetted flowers (petals fail to open properly). Interlocular boring of bolls. Damaged lint turns yellowish-pink. Seeds hollowed out.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Profenophos 50% EC at 2 ml/L or Thiodicarb 75% WP at 1 g/L when first rosetted flowers appear.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Install pheromone traps (Delta traps) at 5/acre for monitoring and mass trapping. Release Trichogramma chilonis at 1.5 lakh/acre.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use Bt cotton varieties. Timely sowing (June-July). Refuge planting of non-Bt cotton (20% area). Destroy crop residue early.
crop_diseases.region: Adilabad, Khammam, Nalgonda, Warangal, Karimnagar - all major cotton belts

crop_diseases.name: American Bollworm (Helicoverpa)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Large irregular holes in bolls. Larvae feed on squares, flowers and bolls. Frass (excrement) visible on bolls. Premature boll opening.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG at 0.4 g/L or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.3 ml/L. Rotate insecticides.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray HaNPV (Helicoverpa Nuclear Polyhedrosis Virus) at 250 LE/acre at dusk. Neem seed kernel extract 5%. Bird perches at 20/acre.
crop_diseases.prevention: Grow trap crops (marigold border, pigeon pea intercrop). Early sowing. Scout weekly from 45 DAS. ETL: 1 larva/plant.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana cotton-growing districts

crop_diseases.name: Bacterial Blight (Angular Leaf Spot)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked angular spots on leaves between veins. Spots turn brown to black. Boll rot with dark sunken lesions. Blackarm on stems.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Copper hydroxide 77% WP at 2.5 g/L or Streptocycline 0.01% + Copper oxychloride 0.3%.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Seed treatment with Pseudomonas fluorescens. Spray neem oil 2%. Remove and destroy infected plants.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use disease-free certified seed. Acid delinting of seed. Avoid overhead irrigation. Crop rotation with non-host crops.
crop_diseases.region: Adilabad, Nirmal, Karimnagar - especially in rainfed cotton areas

crop_diseases.name: Whitefly
crop_diseases.symptoms: Yellowing of leaves. Sticky honeydew on leaves causing sooty mold. Cotton lint becomes sticky (sticky cotton problem). Transmits leaf curl virus.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Diafenthiuron 50% WP at 1.2 g/L or Spiromesifen 22.9% SC at 0.8 ml/L. Avoid pyrethroid sprays.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil 1% or neem seed kernel extract 5%. Use yellow sticky traps at 12/acre. Conserve natural enemies.
crop_diseases.prevention: Remove alternate host weeds. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Do not spray pyrethroids (causes resurgence). Use neem-coated urea.
crop_diseases.region: All cotton-growing areas, severe in hot dry weather

crop_diseases.name: Cotton Leaf Curl Virus (CLCuV)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Upward or downward curling of leaves. Thickening of veins. Leaf enations (outgrowths on underside). Stunted plant growth. Reduced boll formation.
crop_diseases.treatment: No cure for virus. Control whitefly vector with Dinotefuran 20% SG at 0.3 g/L. Uproot severely infected plants.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Install yellow sticky traps. Spray neem oil for whitefly control. Remove infected plants early.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use CLCuV-tolerant varieties. Control whitefly from early stage. Remove weed hosts. Early sowing avoids peak whitefly population.
crop_diseases.region: Emerging problem in Adilabad, Nirmal, and northern Telangana districts

crop_diseases.name: Fruit Rot and Die Back (Anthracnose)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Dark sunken spots on ripe fruits. Die back of branches from tip downwards. Straw-colored concentric rings on fruits. Premature fruit drop.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L alternated with Carbendazim 50% WP at 1 g/L at 10-day intervals.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Bordeaux mixture 1% spray. Seed treatment with Pseudomonas fluorescens.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Hot water seed treatment at 52C for 30 minutes. Crop rotation with non-solanaceous crops. Avoid overhead irrigation.
crop_diseases.region: Warangal, Khammam, Nalgonda - all major chilli-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Chilli Leaf Curl Virus (Murda Complex)
crop_diseases.cause: Begomovirus complex transmitted by whitefly (Bemisia tabaci) and thrips
crop_diseases.symptoms: Upward curling of leaves with puckering. Severe stunting. Bushy appearance. Flower drop. Very poor fruit set.
crop_diseases.treatment: Control vectors: Spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/L for whitefly or Fipronil 5% SC at 2 ml/L for thrips.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Install yellow/blue sticky traps. Spray neem oil 2%. Remove and destroy infected plants. Mulching with silver reflective mulch.
crop_diseases.prevention: Raise nursery under insect-proof net. Transplant healthy seedlings only. Border crop of maize or sorghum as barrier.
crop_diseases.region: Major problem across all Telangana chilli-growing districts

crop_diseases.name: Thrips
crop_diseases.symptoms: Upward curling of leaves. Silvery sheen on leaves. Distorted fruits. Flower drop. Transmits chilli leaf curl virus.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Fipronil 5% SC at 2 ml/L or Spinetoram 11.7% SC at 0.5 ml/L. Spray at early morning or evening.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Blue sticky traps at 12/acre. Spray neem oil 2%. Conserve predatory thrips (Franklinothrips).
crop_diseases.prevention: Destroy previous crop residue. Avoid planting near onion/garlic. Use mulching. Spray starts from 2 weeks after transplanting.
crop_diseases.region: Universal in Telangana chilli fields

crop_diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
crop_diseases.symptoms: White powdery patches on upper leaf surface. Yellow patches on lower surface. Severe defoliation. Reduced fruit quality.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Dinocap 48% EC at 1 ml/L or Wettable sulphur 80% WP at 3 g/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray milk solution (10% milk in water). Apply sulphur dust. Spray neem oil 1%.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid dense planting. Ensure good air circulation. Avoid excess nitrogen. Irrigate at base, not overhead.
crop_diseases.region: Common during dry spells in Warangal, Khammam, Nalgonda

crop_diseases.name: Rhizome Rot (Soft Rot)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions at collar region. Yellowing and wilting of lower leaves progressing upward. Rhizome becomes soft, mushy with foul smell. Plant collapses.
crop_diseases.treatment: Drench with Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP at 2 g/L around plant base. Repeat after 15 days.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride enriched FYM at planting. Drench with Pseudomonas fluorescens at 10 g/L.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use disease-free seed rhizomes. Treat rhizomes with Mancozeb 3 g/L before planting. Good drainage. Ridge planting. Avoid waterlogging.
crop_diseases.region: Nizamabad, Warangal, Jagtial - major turmeric-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Turmeric Leaf Blotch
crop_diseases.symptoms: Small oval to irregular brown spots on both leaf surfaces. Spots enlarge and coalesce. Leaves turn yellow and dry. Severe in prolonged wet weather.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L or Zineb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L at 15-day intervals.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Bordeaux mixture 1% spray. Improve air circulation by proper spacing.
crop_diseases.prevention: Maintain proper spacing (30x20 cm). Avoid overhead irrigation. Remove infected leaves. Ensure good field sanitation.
crop_diseases.region: Nizamabad, Karimnagar turmeric areas during monsoon

crop_diseases.name: Shoot Borer
crop_diseases.symptoms: Central shoot dries up (dead heart). Bore holes visible on pseudostem with frass. Stunted growth. Multiple tillers may form.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.3 ml/L or Quinalphos 25% EC at 2 ml/L into the whorl.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply neem cake at 200 kg/acre at planting. Spray neem oil 2%. Install light traps for adult moths.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use healthy planting material. Earthing up at regular intervals. Remove and destroy infested shoots.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana turmeric-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Fall Armyworm
crop_diseases.symptoms: Ragged feeding on leaves with windowpane effect. Larvae in whorl with copious frass. Can destroy entire crop in early stages. Bore into cobs.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG at 0.4 g/L or Spinetoram 11.7% SC at 0.5 ml/L into the whorl. Target early instar larvae.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply sand + lime mixture (9:1) into whorls. Spray neem oil 5%. Release Telenomus remus egg parasitoid. Spray Metarhizium anisopliae.
crop_diseases.prevention: Early sowing with onset of monsoon. Intercrop with legumes. Bird perches at 20/acre. Pheromone traps at 5/acre for monitoring.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana maize-growing districts - major pest since 2018

crop_diseases.name: Maydis Leaf Blight
crop_diseases.symptoms: Rectangular tan-brown lesions parallel to leaf veins. Lesions enlarge and coalesce causing large dead areas. Lower leaves affected first.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Propiconazole 25% EC at 1 ml/L or Mancozeb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L at disease onset.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Apply neem oil 2%. Remove lower infected leaves.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant hybrids. Crop rotation with non-cereals. Destroy crop debris. Avoid continuous maize cultivation.
crop_diseases.region: Nizamabad, Karimnagar, Adilabad - especially in Kharif season

crop_diseases.name: Stem Borer
crop_diseases.symptoms: Shot holes in unfolding leaves. Dead heart in early growth stage. Stem tunneling causing plant lodging. Frass in bore holes.
crop_diseases.treatment: Apply Carbofuran 3G at 8-10 granules per whorl or Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR in whorl at 20 days after sowing.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Release Trichogramma chilonis egg parasitoids at 1 lakh/acre. Apply neem seed kernel extract 5% in whorl.
crop_diseases.prevention: Timely sowing. Remove and destroy crop stubble. Intercrop with cowpea. Balanced fertilization.
crop_diseases.region: All maize areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Fusarium Wilt
crop_diseases.symptoms: Gradual wilting starting from lower leaves. Yellowing and drooping. Brown discoloration of vascular tissue visible when stem is split. Entire plant dies.
crop_diseases.treatment: No effective chemical cure once established. Seed treatment with Carbendazim 2 g/kg + Trichoderma viride 4 g/kg seed.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride enriched FYM at 2.5 kg/acre. Seed treatment with Trichoderma.
crop_diseases.prevention: Grow wilt-resistant varieties (ICPL 87119 - Asha, ICPL 87). Crop rotation with cereals. Deep summer ploughing. Avoid continuous pigeonpea.
crop_diseases.region: Mahbubnagar, Nalgonda, Adilabad - major pigeonpea areas

crop_diseases.name: Sterility Mosaic Disease
crop_diseases.cause: Pigeonpea Sterility Mosaic Virus transmitted by eriophyid mite (Aceria cajani)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Excessive bushy growth with small pale green leaves. Mosaic mottling. Partial or complete sterility - no flowers or pods. Severe stunting.
crop_diseases.treatment: Control mite vector with Wettable sulphur 80% WP at 3 g/L or Dicofol 18.5% EC at 2.5 ml/L. Two sprays at 15-day interval.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil 3% to control mites. Remove and destroy infected plants. Use resistant varieties.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant varieties (ICPL 87119, BDN 708). Early sowing. Rogue out infected plants. Maintain isolation from infected fields.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana pigeonpea-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Pod Borer Complex (Helicoverpa + Maruca)
crop_diseases.cause: Insects - Helicoverpa armigera and Maruca vitrata
crop_diseases.symptoms: Circular holes in pods. Larvae feed on developing seeds inside pods. Frass on pods. Up to 80% pod damage in severe cases.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG at 0.4 g/L at 50% flowering. Follow with Chlorantraniliprole if needed.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray HaNPV at 250 LE/acre at dusk. Neem seed kernel extract 5%. Bird perches. Intercrop with sorghum.
crop_diseases.prevention: Early sowing. Short-duration varieties to escape late-season pest buildup. Scout from flowering stage. ETL: 2 larvae/plant.
crop_diseases.region: All pigeonpea-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Fusarium Wilt
crop_diseases.cause: Fungus - Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. ciceri
crop_diseases.symptoms: Drooping and yellowing of leaves. Plants wilt suddenly or gradually. Roots show brown to black discoloration. Vascular browning in stem cross-section.
crop_diseases.treatment: Seed treatment with Vitavax Power (Carboxin + Thiram) 3 g/kg seed. Soil drenching with Carbendazim 1 g/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Seed treatment with Trichoderma viride 4 g/kg. Apply Trichoderma enriched compost at sowing. Bio-agent soil application.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use wilt-resistant varieties (JG 11, KAK 2, Vihar). Crop rotation (3-4 year). Deep summer ploughing. Avoid excess irrigation.
crop_diseases.region: Karimnagar, Medak, Adilabad, Siddipet

crop_diseases.name: Dry Root Rot
crop_diseases.symptoms: Sudden drying of plants at reproductive stage. Roots become dark brown and brittle. Minute sclerotia (black dots) on roots. Entire plant dries standing.
crop_diseases.treatment: Seed treatment with Carboxin + Thiram at 3 g/kg. No effective post-infection treatment.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride enriched FYM. Seed treatment with Trichoderma. Ensure adequate soil moisture during flowering.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid moisture stress during pod filling. Timely sowing. Deeper sowing (8-10 cm) for better root development. Mulching.
crop_diseases.region: Rainfed chickpea areas, especially during terminal drought

crop_diseases.name: Pod Borer (Helicoverpa)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Circular holes in pods. Larvae feed on developing seeds. One larva can destroy 30-40 pods. Frass visible on damaged pods.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Indoxacarb 14.5% SC at 0.75 ml/L or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG at 0.4 g/L at 50% podding.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: HaNPV at 250 LE/acre. Neem oil 5% spray. Bird perches at 20/acre. Hand-pick large larvae.
crop_diseases.prevention: Intercrop with linseed or safflower. Grow trap crops. Pheromone traps for monitoring. Scout from flowering.
crop_diseases.region: All chickpea-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Tikka Disease (Early and Late Leaf Spot)
crop_diseases.cause: Fungi - Cercospora arachidicola (early) and Cercosporidium personatum (late)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Early: Small dark brown circular spots on upper leaf surface with yellow halo. Late: Dark brown to black spots on both surfaces. Severe defoliation.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Chlorothalonil 75% WP at 2 g/L or Tebuconazole 25.9% EC at 1 ml/L at 35, 50 and 65 DAS.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Bordeaux mixture 1%. Neem oil 2%.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Deep ploughing after harvest. Crop rotation. Avoid close spacing. Remove crop debris.
crop_diseases.region: Mahbubnagar, Wanaparthy, Nalgonda - major groundnut areas

crop_diseases.name: Stem Rot (Sclerotium Wilt)
crop_diseases.symptoms: White fan-shaped mycelial growth at stem base near soil line. Brown mustard-seed like sclerotia on stem and soil. Wilting and death of branches or whole plant.
crop_diseases.treatment: Seed treatment with Carboxin + Thiram at 3 g/kg. Soil drenching with Tebuconazole 1 ml/L around affected plants.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride + neem cake mixture in furrows. Remove and destroy infected plants with surrounding soil.
crop_diseases.prevention: Deep summer ploughing. Avoid continuous groundnut. Apply lime if soil is acidic. Balanced fertilization. Proper spacing.
crop_diseases.region: All Telangana groundnut areas, especially in sandy soils

crop_diseases.name: Groundnut Bud Necrosis Virus (GBNV)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Necrosis of terminal buds. Chlorotic and necrotic rings on leaves. Severe stunting. Axillary shoot proliferation. No or malformed pods.
crop_diseases.treatment: Control thrips vector with Fipronil 5% SC at 2 ml/L or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Blue sticky traps at 12/acre. Neem oil 2% spray for thrips control. Remove infected plants early.
crop_diseases.prevention: Early sowing with onset of monsoon. Use tolerant varieties. Border crop of maize or pearl millet. Intercrop with fast-growing cereals.
crop_diseases.region: Mahbubnagar, Wanaparthy, Nagarkurnool

crop_diseases.name: Late Blight
crop_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked dark green to brown lesions on leaves, starting from edges. White mold growth on underside of leaves in humid weather. Fruits develop brown firm rot.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP at 2.5 g/L or Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP at 2.5 g/L. Repeat at 7-day intervals.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Bordeaux mixture 1%. Apply Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Improve air circulation. Remove infected plant parts.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation. Stake plants for air circulation. Use resistant varieties. Destroy volunteer tomato plants. Crop rotation.
crop_diseases.region: All tomato-growing areas of Telangana, especially during cool wet weather

crop_diseases.name: Tomato Leaf Curl Virus (ToLCV)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Upward curling of leaflets. Interveinal yellowing. Stunted plant growth. Flower drop. Reduced or no fruit set. Severe yield loss.
crop_diseases.treatment: Control whitefly: Spray Diafenthiuron 50% WP at 1.2 g/L or Pyriproxyfen 10% EC at 1 ml/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Yellow sticky traps at 12/acre. Neem oil 2% spray. Remove and destroy infected plants. Silver mulch reflects whiteflies.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use ToLCV-resistant varieties (Arka Rakshak, Arka Samrat). Raise nursery under insect-proof net. Avoid proximity to infected fields.
crop_diseases.region: Major problem in all Telangana tomato-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Fruit Borer (Helicoverpa armigera)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Circular bore holes on fruits with frass. Larvae feed inside fruit causing rotting. Single larva can damage 6-8 fruits.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.3 ml/L or Indoxacarb 14.5% SC at 0.75 ml/L. Start sprays at fruit setting.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: HaNPV spray at 250 LE/acre at dusk. Neem oil 5%. Bird perches. Pheromone traps for monitoring.
crop_diseases.prevention: Marigold border crop as trap. Scout from flowering. Hand-pick large larvae. Destroy infected fruits.
crop_diseases.region: All tomato-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Bacterial Wilt
crop_diseases.symptoms: Sudden wilting of entire plant without yellowing. Browning of vascular tissue visible in stem cross-section. Bacterial ooze test: milky stream from cut stem in water.
crop_diseases.treatment: No effective chemical treatment once infected. Remove and destroy infected plants. Drench healthy plants with Streptocycline 0.01%.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Pseudomonas fluorescens to soil at 2.5 kg/acre. Trichoderma viride enriched FYM. Soil solarization.
crop_diseases.prevention: Grafting on resistant rootstock (Solanum torvum). Raised beds for good drainage. Crop rotation with non-solanaceous crops. Avoid waterlogging.
crop_diseases.region: Common in heavy soils and waterlogged areas across Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
crop_diseases.symptoms: White powdery coating on panicles, flowers, and young fruits. Flower drop and fruit drop. Affected fruits remain small and distorted.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Wettable sulphur 80% WP at 3 g/L or Hexaconazole 5% EC at 1 ml/L at panicle emergence. Repeat at 15-day interval.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil 1%. Sulphur dust application. Spray milk whey solution 10%.
crop_diseases.prevention: Pre-bloom spray with sulphur. Prune crowded branches for air circulation. Avoid excess nitrogen. Remove fallen debris.
crop_diseases.region: All mango-growing areas of Telangana, especially Rangareddy, Mahbubnagar, Medak

crop_diseases.name: Mango Hopper
crop_diseases.cause: Insects - Idioscopus clypealis, I. nitidulus, Amritodus atkinsoni
crop_diseases.symptoms: Nymphs and adults suck sap from inflorescence and tender parts. Honeydew secretion causes sooty mold. Flower and fruit drop. Wedge-shaped insects on panicles.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/L or Lambda-cyhalothrin 5% EC at 0.5 ml/L at panicle emergence and at full bloom.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil 3%. Smoke orchard in evening to deter hoppers. Conserve natural predators like spiders.
crop_diseases.prevention: Prune dense canopy for light and air. Avoid excess nitrogen. Remove water shoots. Clean orchard floor.
crop_diseases.region: Universal in Telangana mango orchards

crop_diseases.name: Anthracnose
crop_diseases.symptoms: Black spots on leaves, flowers, and fruits. Blossom blight causing flower blackening and drop. Post-harvest black spots and rot on ripe fruits.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Carbendazim 50% WP at 1 g/L or Thiophanate-methyl 70% WP at 1 g/L. Pre-harvest spray 15 days before harvest.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Hot water treatment of fruits at 52C for 5 minutes. Bordeaux mixture 1% spray. Trichoderma spray on flowers.
crop_diseases.prevention: Pre-bloom spray with copper fungicide. Post-harvest hot water dip. Proper harvesting without injury. Good orchard sanitation.
crop_diseases.region: All mango areas, especially in humid conditions

crop_diseases.name: Mango Fruit Fly
crop_diseases.symptoms: Oviposition punctures on ripening fruits. Larvae (maggots) feed inside fruit pulp. Premature fruit drop. Rotting of fruit with maggots inside.
crop_diseases.treatment: Bait spray: Malathion 50% EC at 2 ml/L + jaggery 10 g/L as bait. Spray on trunk and lower canopy, NOT on fruits.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Methyl eugenol traps (pheromone traps) at 10/acre. Collect and destroy fallen fruits daily. Bag fruits individually on tree.
crop_diseases.prevention: Harvest at mature green stage. Field sanitation - destroy fallen fruits. Plough orchard to expose pupae. Early season trapping.
crop_diseases.region: All mango-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Yellow Mosaic Virus (YMV)
crop_diseases.cause: Mungbean Yellow Mosaic India Virus transmitted by whitefly (Bemisia tabaci)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Bright yellow patches on leaves in irregular pattern. Severe yellowing of entire leaves in late infection. Stunted growth. Reduced pod formation.
crop_diseases.treatment: Control whitefly vector: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG at 0.2 g/L or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Yellow sticky traps at 12/acre. Neem oil 2% spray. Remove infected plants. Grow resistant varieties.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use YMV-resistant varieties (JS 335, NRC 37). Early sowing. Avoid staggered planting. Control weeds that host whitefly.
crop_diseases.region: Adilabad, Nirmal, Mancherial - soybean-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Girdle Beetle
crop_diseases.symptoms: Beetle girdles the stem/petiole by making two rings. Plant part above girdle dries up. Larvae bore inside stem. Stem breakage at girdle point.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Profenophos 50% EC at 2 ml/L or Triazophos 40% EC at 1.5 ml/L at 25-30 DAS.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Hand collect girdled plant parts and destroy. Neem oil 5% spray. Intercrop with red gram.
crop_diseases.prevention: Timely sowing. Avoid late planting. Seed treatment with Thiamethoxam 30% FS at 10 ml/kg. Deep ploughing after harvest.
crop_diseases.region: Adilabad, Nirmal, northern Telangana soybean areas

crop_diseases.name: Red Rot
crop_diseases.symptoms: Drying of top leaves followed by withering. When cane is split: reddish internal tissue with transverse white patches. Acid sour smell. Cane becomes hollow.
crop_diseases.treatment: No effective chemical treatment once established. Remove and burn infected canes. Sett treatment with Carbendazim 1 g/L for 30 minutes.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Sett treatment with Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L for 30 minutes. Apply bio-agents to soil.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Plant disease-free setts from healthy crop. Avoid ratoon of susceptible varieties. Hot water treatment of setts at 50C/2 hours.
crop_diseases.region: Nizamabad, Kamareddy, Medak sugarcane areas

crop_diseases.name: Early Shoot Borer
crop_diseases.symptoms: Dead heart in young shoots (1-3 months age). Central leaf dries and can be pulled out. Bore holes at base of shoot. Offensive smell from dead heart.
crop_diseases.treatment: Apply Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR at 20 kg/ha in furrows. Or Fipronil 0.3% GR at 25 kg/ha.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Release Trichogramma chilonis at 50,000 per acre, 6 releases at 10-day intervals starting from 30 days after planting.
crop_diseases.prevention: Earthing up at 45 and 90 days. Trash mulching. Light trap installation. Detrash lower leaves. Avoid moisture stress.
crop_diseases.region: All sugarcane areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Purple Blotch
crop_diseases.symptoms: Small water-soaked lesions on leaves. Lesions enlarge with purple center and yellow halo. Concentric rings visible. Affected leaves collapse and dry.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L alternating with Tebuconazole 25.9% EC at 1 ml/L at 10-day intervals.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Bordeaux mixture 1%. Improve drainage.
crop_diseases.prevention: Proper spacing for air circulation. Avoid overhead irrigation. Balanced NPK. Remove infected debris. Crop rotation.
crop_diseases.region: Kamareddy, Nizamabad, Sangareddy - onion-growing areas

crop_diseases.name: Onion Thrips
crop_diseases.symptoms: Silvery white streaks on leaves. Leaf tips turn brown and curl. Stunted growth in severe cases. Bulb size reduced.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Fipronil 5% SC at 2 ml/L or Spinetoram 11.7% SC at 0.5 ml/L. Spray at base of plant. Add sticker.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Blue sticky traps at 12/acre. Neem oil 2% spray. Conserve predators like predatory thrips and ladybird beetles.
crop_diseases.prevention: Mulch with paddy straw (reflective). Avoid water stress. 2-3 rows of maize as barrier crop. Sprinkler irrigation reduces thrips.
crop_diseases.region: All onion-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Alternaria Leaf Blight
crop_diseases.symptoms: Dark brown circular to irregular spots on leaves with concentric rings. Spots coalesce causing large necrotic areas. Premature defoliation and head rot.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP at 2.5 g/L or Propiconazole 25% EC at 1 ml/L at disease onset. Repeat at 10-day interval.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Bordeaux mixture 1%. Remove infected plant debris.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant hybrids. Crop rotation. Proper spacing. Avoid excess irrigation during flowering.
crop_diseases.region: Medak, Sangareddy, Siddipet, Kamareddy

crop_diseases.name: Head Rot (Sclerotinia Rot)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked lesion on back of head. White cottony mycelial growth. Head droops and rots. Black sclerotia form inside head. Seeds become chaffy.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Carbendazim 50% WP at 1 g/L on heads at flower initiation and seed filling stage.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Spray Trichoderma viride at 4 g/L. Improve field drainage. Avoid dense planting.
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid waterlogging during flowering. Wide spacing. Do not grow sunflower after sunflower. Destroy crop debris.
crop_diseases.region: Sunflower areas of Medak and Sangareddy districts

crop_diseases.name: Yellow Mosaic Virus
crop_diseases.cause: Mungbean Yellow Mosaic India Virus transmitted by whitefly (Bemisia tabaci)
crop_diseases.symptoms: Irregular yellow and green patches on leaves. Complete yellowing of leaves in severe infection. Stunted pods. Reduced seed size and quality.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG at 0.2 g/L or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/L to control whitefly vector.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Yellow sticky traps at 12/acre. Neem oil 2%. Remove and destroy infected plants.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use resistant varieties (SML 668, IPM 02-03). Early sowing. Seed treatment with Imidacloprid 70% WS at 5 g/kg.
crop_diseases.region: Karimnagar, Nizamabad, Warangal, Adilabad

crop_diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
crop_diseases.symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves, stems and pods. Yellowing and premature defoliation. Shriveled seeds in affected pods.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Wettable sulphur 80% WP at 3 g/L or Carbendazim 50% WP at 1 g/L.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Sulphur dust application. Neem oil 1% spray. Milk spray (10% dilution).
crop_diseases.prevention: Avoid late sowing. Use resistant varieties. Proper spacing. Avoid excess nitrogen.
crop_diseases.region: All green gram areas, especially during dry weather

crop_diseases.name: Grain Mold
crop_diseases.cause: Complex of fungi - Fusarium moniliforme, Aspergillus flavus, Curvularia lunata
crop_diseases.symptoms: Discolored grains - pink, black, or grey mold on grain surface at maturity. Reduced grain quality and germination. Mycotoxin contamination risk.
crop_diseases.treatment: Spray Carbendazim 50% WP at 1 g/L or Propiconazole 25% EC at 1 ml/L at grain filling stage if rains are expected.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Harvest promptly at physiological maturity. Dry grains immediately to below 12% moisture.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use mold-resistant varieties (CSV 17, CSV 22). Avoid late sowing. Bird perches for insect control. Timely harvest.
crop_diseases.region: Mahbubnagar, Nagarkurnool - rainy season sorghum areas

crop_diseases.name: Shoot Fly
crop_diseases.symptoms: Dead heart - central shoot dries and can be pulled out easily. Characteristic egg on underside of leaf. Deadheart can be identified by cut at stem base.
crop_diseases.treatment: Seed treatment with Imidacloprid 70% WS at 10 g/kg seed. Spray Chlorpyriphos 20% EC at 2.5 ml/L at 7-10 DAS.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Fishmeal trap at 12/acre. NSKE 5% spray. Intercrop with 2 rows of cowpea for every 4 rows of sorghum.
crop_diseases.prevention: Timely sowing with onset of monsoon. Higher seed rate for compensation. Thinning dead heart plants. Balanced fertilization.
crop_diseases.region: All sorghum-growing areas of Telangana

crop_diseases.name: Panama Wilt (Fusarium Wilt)
crop_diseases.cause: Fungus - Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cubense
crop_diseases.symptoms: Yellowing of older leaves from margin inward. Leaves collapse and hang around pseudostem (skirt-like). Longitudinal splitting of pseudostem base. Brown vascular discoloration.
crop_diseases.treatment: No effective chemical treatment. Remove and destroy infected plants with rhizome. Treat surrounding plants with Carbendazim drench.
crop_diseases.organic_treatment: Apply Trichoderma viride enriched neem cake at 2 kg/plant. Bio-agent soil drenching. Pseudomonas fluorescens application.
crop_diseases.prevention: Use tissue culture plants from disease-free labs. Avoid planting in previously infected soil. Crop rotation for 3 years. Use resistant varieties.
crop_diseases.region: Khammam, Warangal, Bhadradri Kothagudem banana-growing areas
